channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. intervention in Venezuela divides Houston
item.description: In nearly two dozen interviews, Houstonians expressed everything from admiration and relief to skepticism and dread following the seizure of leader Nicolás Maduro.
item.content:encoded:
In nearly two dozen interviews, Houstonians expressed everything from admiration and relief to skepticism and dread following the seizure of leader Nicolás Maduro.

(Image credit: Danielle Villasana for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Don Lemon and Georgia Fort vow to continue reporting following arrests tied to anti-ICE protest
item.description: The two independent journalists face federal charges related to the interruption of a church service in Minnesota earlier this month. Lemon and Fort say they were there to cover a protest.
item.content:encoded:
The two independent journalists face federal charges related to the interruption of a church service in Minnesota earlier this month. Lemon and Fort say they were there to cover a protest.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: As shutdown begins, lawmakers clash over how immigration agents operate
item.description: A partial government shutdown is now underway. How long it will last depends on congressional agreement over a DHS funding deal that proposes new guardrails on immigration enforcement.
item.content:encoded: A partial government shutdown is now underway. How long it will last depends on congressional agreement over a DHS funding deal that proposes new guardrails on immigration enforcement.
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Judge orders release of 5-year-old Liam Ramos and his dad from ICE detention
item.description: A judge has ordered the U.S. to release a father and 5-year-old son who were taken into custody during the immigration crackdown in Minnesota. A judge previously ruled that they could not be removed from the U.S. for now.
item.content:encoded:
A judge has ordered the U.S. to release a father and 5-year-old son who were taken into custody during the immigration crackdown in Minnesota. A judge previously ruled that they could not be removed from the U.S. for now.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Judge says she won't halt the immigration enforcement surge as a lawsuit proceeds
item.description: U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi praised the ruling on social media, calling it "another HUGE" legal win for the Justice Department.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi praised the ruling on social media, calling it "another HUGE" legal win for the Justice Department.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Minneapolis Police Chief discusses his force's relationship with federal immigration agents
item.description: Minneapolis Police Chief Brian O'Hara sees little attempts at de-escalation from the some 3,000 federal immigration agents — four times the number of sworn MPD officers — in the city.
item.content:encoded: Minneapolis Police Chief Brian O'Hara sees little attempts at de-escalation from the some 3,000 federal immigration agents — four times the number of sworn MPD officers — in the city.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: A video showed unicyclists riding while shoveling snow. A journalist set out to decide if it was AI or real life
item.description: Were there really unicyclists clearing snow in Somerville, Mass., or was it AI sorcery? An intrepid Boston Globe reporter found out.
item.content:encoded: Were there really unicyclists clearing snow in Somerville, Mass., or was it AI sorcery? An intrepid Boston Globe reporter found out.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: The U.S. will likely lose its measles elimination status. Here's what that means
item.description: The South Carolina measles outbreak is now bigger than last year's Texas outbreak and is happening as the U.S. is poised to lose its measles elimination status.
item.content:encoded:
The South Carolina measles outbreak is now bigger than last year's Texas outbreak and is happening as the U.S. is poised to lose its measles elimination status.

(Image credit: Annie Rice)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: A red hat, inspired by a symbol of resistance to Nazi occupation, gains traction in Minnesota
item.description: A Minneapolis knitting shop has resurrected the design of a Norwegian cap worn to protest Nazi occupation. Its owner says the money raised from hat pattern sales will support the local immigrant community.
item.content:encoded:
A Minneapolis knitting shop has resurrected the design of a Norwegian cap worn to protest Nazi occupation. Its owner says the money raised from hat pattern sales will support the local immigrant community.

(Image credit: Gilah Mashaal)
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: DHS keeps making false claims about people. It's part of a broader pattern
item.description: Trump administration officials have falsely linked Alex Pretti and Renee Macklin Good to domestic terrorism. It's part of a larger pattern by the Department of Homeland Security.
item.content:encoded:
Trump administration officials have falsely linked Alex Pretti and Renee Macklin Good to domestic terrorism. It's part of a larger pattern by the Department of Homeland Security.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block
